description: Microbiology examines the morphology, composition, metabolism and genetics of microorganisms with emphasis on the bacteria and viruses. Students examine the dynamic impact of microbes on humans, the immune response and the role of microbes in the environment. Students attend lectures plus one 3-hour laboratory per week. Taught annually. Prerequisites: Biology 125 and Chemistry 121 or 125.
name: Microbiology
notes: Students in Bio 231 must also register for one lab Bio 231 AL, BL, or CL.
